Get all AppConfigs. This operation is only allowed for admin users.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Start with [AppConfig] number equal to offset. Default is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of [AppConfig] to fetch. Default is 20.

post.description: Create AppConfig. The field [uuid] MUST BE unique for each application. Use a OS-spesific device id or a [universally unique identifier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier).

get.description: Get AppConfig. A configuration is unique for each application regardless of which user is logged in.

patch.description: Update AppConfig. Only fields in request are updated. Existing values WILL BE overwritten, others remain unchanged.

requestBody.description: Update AppConfig. Only fields in request are updated.

get.description: Get all Incidents. The actual incidents returned by this operation depends on which scope the user have.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Start with [Incident] number equal to offset. Default is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of [Incident] to fetch. Default is 20.

post.description: Create Incident. The field [uuid] MUST BE unique for each incident. Use a [universally unique identifier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier).

get.description: Get Incident. Admins will get all incidents, all other roles will get the incidents based on affiliation.

patch.description: Update Incident. Only fields in request are updated. Existing values WILL BE overwritten, others remain unchanged.

requestBody.description: Update Incident. Only fields in request are updated.

201.description: Created. The POST-ed resource was created.

204.description: No Content. The resource was updated.

400.description: Bad request. Request contains wrong or is missing required data

401.description: Unauthorized. The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

403.description: Forbidden. The client does not have access rights to the content.

404.description: Not found. The requested resource does not exist in server.

405.description: Method Not Allowed. The request method is known by the server but has been disabled and cannot be used.

409.description: Conflict. This response is sent when a request conflicts with the current state of the server.

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is not ready to handle the request. Common causes are a server that is down for maintenance or that is overloaded.

InsufficientScope.description: The provided credentials or bearer token have insufficient permission to access this route.
